page.title: 08Customs - May Day(2)
page.content:
{Customs}-{May Day}- by Emma Morton _________________ The Juniors dance three traditional {country dances.} The{Maypole}is placed in the centre of the playground. Six boys lead their partners to the maypole, pick up their braids and dance the Barber's Pole, Single Plaitting, Spider's Web, Gipsy's Tent and Double Plaitting dances. They drop their braids and skip round the maypole three times and round the side of the school. The rest of the school follow with the May Queen walking last
There are various stalls and games such as Lucky Dip, Skittles, Tombola, Ice Cream and Drinks, Coffee and Cakes and White Elephant around the school.
At the end of the day everyone goes home.
